turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my latest bill. I was charged $75, but my plan is supposed to be $50.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello, thank you for contacting us. I understand you have a billing inquiry. Can I please have your account number or phone number associated with the account?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's 555-123-4567. And honestly, this is really frustrating. I thought I had sorted this out last month!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please give me a moment while I access your account information. Okay, I see the account. It shows a charge of $75. Can you specify what plan you believe you are on?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I signed up for the 'Basic Plus' plan, which was advertised at $50 a month. I even have a screenshot I took when I signed up. Why am I being overcharged?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The system shows you enrolled in 'Standard' plan. However, let me check something for you...

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay... what is the difference between the 'Basic Plus' and the 'Standard' plan? I didn't see anything about a 'Standard' plan when I signed up.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The Standard plan offers slightly faster download speeds and includes premium channels. Looking at your account notes, it seems there was a promotional upgrade applied automatically when you signed up. I will remove the 'Standard' plan from your account and apply a credit of $25 to reflect the difference in cost. That should correct the billing discrepancy.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: So, going forward, I'll only be charged $50? And how long will it take for the credit to show up? Will it be on my next bill?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, you will only be charged $50 moving forward. The credit should reflect on your next billing statement, which will be available online in approximately 3-5 business days. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
